medical_history.chief_complaint: Joint pain and crampy diarrhea associated with meals.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 7 years and included generalized aching and pain in the hands and feet that worsened over time. Recently, numbness in the hands and feet has occurred, varying with ambient temperature. The patient has experienced intermittent bouts of fever with a temperature of up to 40.6Â°C, lasting 1 or 2 days, partly due to an inability to sweat normally. Pain in the hands and feet became extremely intense during the febrile episodes. The patient found considerable relief from painful acroparesthesias with carbamazepine but discontinued it due to drowsiness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has had some hearing difficulties, dry eyes and mouth, and a generalized lack of sweating throughout life, though some sweating has recently returned over the forehead and chest. History of taking phenytoin and gabapentin for neuropathic pain.
medical_history.family_history: One brother with Fabry disease died at 42 years from myocardial infarction, two cousins with the disease died from strokes, and two maternal uncles also had the disease.
